Alternatively, "Maleficent" is another excellent choice. It's a modern take on the classic Sleeping Beauty tale, featuring Angelina Jolie as the iconic villainess in a beautiful fantasy setting. Enjoy!

I'd highly recommend "Born on the Fourth of July" if you enjoyed Inglourious Basterds. Based on a true story, it tells the transformation of Ron Kovic from a patriotic soldier to an anti-war activist after his experiences in the Vietnam War. The film features a star-studded cast including Tom Cruise and Willem Dafoe.

Another compelling watch is "Casablanca," a classic tale set during World War II, about an expatriate American cafe owner who struggles with his loyalties as war rages around him. Humphrey Bogart delivers an iconic performance in this timeless film.

conversation.text: Both "The Imitation Game" and "The Patriot" are excellent choices if you're interested in war-themed movies, as they offer compelling stories set during different periods of World War II. In "The Imitation Game," Benedict Cumberbatch plays the role of Alan Turing, a brilliant mathematician who works to crack the German Enigma code. On the other hand, "The Patriot" features Mel Gibson as Benjamin Martin, a peaceful farmer turned militia leader in the American Revolution after his son is murdered by British forces. Enjoy!
